etymologies: early 17th century (earlier as spry): related to Middle Dutch spra(e)yen ‘sprinkle’

definitions: liquid that is blown or driven through the air in the form of tiny drops

examples.text: a torrent of white foam and spray

shortDefinitions: liquid that is blown or driven through air in form of tiny drops

definitions: a liquid preparation which can be forced out of a can or other container in tiny drops
shortDefinitions: liquid preparation which can be forced out of can

definitions: a can or container holding a spray.
an act of applying a spray

examples.text: refresh your flowers with a quick spray

notes.text: with object and adverbial of direction

definitions: apply (liquid) to someone or something in the form of a shower of tiny drops

examples.text: the product can be sprayed onto wet or dry hair

shortDefinitions: apply liquid to person or thing in form of tiny drops

definitions: sprinkle or cover (someone or something) with a shower of tiny drops of liquid
shortDefinitions: sprinkle or cover with tiny drops of liquid

definitions: (of liquid) be driven through the air or forced out of something in tiny drops

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: be driven through air or forced out of something in tiny drops

definitions: treat (a plant) with insecticide or herbicide in a spray

examples.text: avoid spraying your plants with pesticides

shortDefinitions: treat plant with insecticide or herbicide in such way

examples.text: the truck shuddered to a halt, spraying gravel from under its wheels

shortDefinitions: scatter something somewhere with great force

definitions: fire a rapid succession of bullets at

examples.text: enemy gunners sprayed the decks of the warships

shortDefinitions: fire rapid succession of bullets at

definitions: (of a male cat) direct a stream of urine over (an object or area) to mark a territory

examples.text: cats usually spray areas they have sprayed before
many people try to discourage their cats from spraying

shortDefinitions: (of male cat) direct stream of urine over object or area

definitions: (in a sporting context) kick, hit, or throw (the ball) in an unpredictable or inaccurate direction

examples.text: he began his round by spraying his fairway shots

shortDefinitions: (in sport) kick, hit, or throw ball in unpredictable way

etymologies: Middle English: representing late Old English (e)sprei, recorded in personal and place names, of unknown origin

definitions: a stem or small branch of a tree or plant, bearing flowers and foliage
shortDefinitions: stem or small branch of tree or plant, bearing flowers and foliage

definitions: a bunch of cut flowers arranged in an attractive way

examples.text: a spray of yellow chrysanthemums and red roses

shortDefinitions: bunch of cut flowers arranged in attractive way

definitions: a brooch in the form of a bouquet of flowers

examples.text: a diamond and emerald spray brooch

shortDefinitions: brooch in form of bouquet of flowers
